snippet: As the St. John’s baseball program makes its N.C.A.A. tournament run, memories of one of the greatest games ever played remain strong.
abstract: St John’s baseball team is making its first appearance in the NCAA tournament’s super regional against Arizona in Tucson, but the university’s well of baseball history is deep; it is a history enriched by a celebrated pitcher’s duel between Ron Darling and Frank Viola on May 21, 1981, that, for many, is considered the best college baseball game ever played.
lead_paragraph: As the St. John’s baseball program makes its N.C.A.A. tournament run, memories of one of the greatest games ever played remain strong.

headline.seo: Darling-Viola Pitcher’s Duel Lives On in St. John’s Baseball Lore
headline.main: Viola-Darling Pitching Duel in 1981 Has Not Been Forgotten
headline.print_headline: Viola-Darling Duel in 1981 Has Not Been Forgotten
